Who is able to supply info on the Sugi family ? They were major vassal of t=
he =D4uchi and had more than one branch. I find in my files Sugi Shigeaki i=
n 1399, his grandson Yoriaki in 1413. Later, around 1480/90, Sugi Shigetaka=
, Shigechika and Takemichi were high officials of the =D4uchi. At the begin=
ning of the XVIe century, some were among counsellors of the =D4uchi's head=
 (Shigenori, Okinaga) while others served as shugodai of Buzen and Chikuzen=
. In 1528, for instance, Okitsura, son of Okifusa, was shugodai of Chikuzen=
 but two years later, the shugodai of that province seems to have been Okik=
azu. At the time of the fall of the =D4uchi, the counsellor Sugi Shigemasa =
revolted and joined Sue while Sugi Okitsura choose to die like his master =
=D4uchi Yoshitaka in 1551. In 1554, a Sugi Takayasu was killed in Chikugo, =
fighting against M=F4ri Motonari. All this is a bit confusing and I would b=
e glad to understand the relationship between those various members of the =
Sugi clan as well as their history. Thank you
